summary: Email correspondence between attorneys and a client regarding scheduling a deposition in the Epstein case. The client requests a delay until mid-January due to health issues and personal circumstances, while attorneys discuss strategies for postponement and alternative arrangements.

events.title: Deposition Scheduling Discussion
events.description: Email correspondence about postponing a deposition due to health issues and requesting delay until mid-January.

events.title: Medical Appointment
events.description: Client mentions having a medical appointment and discusses health issues affecting ability to participate in deposition.

keyFacts: A client in the Epstein case requests postponement of deposition until mid-January due to health issues making concentration difficult.
Attorneys discuss strategies for delaying deposition, including obtaining medical documentation without excessive detail.
Alternative arrangements are considered, including conducting the deposition in London if travel is not possible.
The correspondence shows legal team coordination involving multiple attorneys and staff members.
The document reveals ongoing deposition scheduling challenges in late 2018 related to the Epstein case.
